introduction.p: Good bug report names help developers quickly identify the general part of their code the bug occurred in. Most bug patterns have a suggested name pattern with slots indicating what ought to fill them. But sometimes it is still not obvious how to fill a slot. The guidelines below may help in cases of slot confusion and where there is no name pattern.

guidelines.p: Here are some guidelines for naming bug reports:

ul.li: The name of the interface object or feature should be first in the name. Capitalize the first letter.

If there are a few major test cases or types of the object, a qualifying word should come after the object name, preceeded by a colon ":". E.g., Format toolbar appearance .. or Format toolbar: font size ..
Use a couple of words to give an idea of what action caused the failure.
Normally at the end, use a couple of words or words from a failure message to tell what the failure was or what the resulting behavior was.
